info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:52AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Otsego, Delaware and northern Sullivan Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 352 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Oneonta to near Peabrook. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rockland, Oneonta, Fallsburg, Liberty, Neversink, South Fallsburg, Walton, Delhi, Davenport and Roxbury. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 89 and 101. Interstate 88 between 13 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
